text:
Hi,

Could you add FastCGI support (to the standard Apache distribution?
creator: OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com

text:
Please see mod_proxy_fcgi, which implements fastcgi support.  Your contributions
will be welcome: if you're not a programmer, test-drive it and report back with
your experiences.

The existing mod_fastcgi and mod_fcgid implementations are owned and maintained
by developers outside the ASF.  That's how open-source software works: these
third-party developers offer value-added products on terms of their choice.  If
that's a problem for you, hire a consultant to help with integration.
creator: nick@webthing.com

text:
Where do I find mod_proxy_fcgi binaries and documentation? And a to do list?

> If that's a problem for you, hire a consultant to help with integration.

I'd probably switch to Lighttpd instead.
creator: OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com
rpluem@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Where do I find mod_proxy_fcgi binaries and documentation? And a to do list?

Currently this module is only in the trunk.
What about a to do list? Documentation?
creator: OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com

text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> What about a to do list? Documentation?

No ToDo list and no documentation as far as I know. But documentation would be a
good point for a ToDo list :-).
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
Too bad I don't like writing documentation.
What are the plans for this module? Let it rot until a volunteer completes it?

BTW, why has this been marked as RESOLVED FIXED while the feature isn't included
at all yet?
creator: OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com
